page.title: 20BRITISH STANDARDS INSTITUTE
page.content: B.S.I. stands for British Standards Institution. It is an independent organisation incorporated by royal charter. British Standards are technical agreements published in booklet form by B.S.I. At present there are 8000 British Standards of which some 30 are for consumer goods. British Standards products are written for all kinds of things from products for industry such as power transformers, industrial eye protectors, concrete pipes and safety footwear to equipment for schools, hospitals and sports and for domestic products of all types. British Standards has also got a special stamp mark to prove that whatever the things are they are equal to specifications. British Standards are sited at Linford Wood. 350 people are currently employed there.
